page.title: 09T. JAMES - WEST SLEEKBURN
page.content: This haulage company began in 1918 and was founded by two brothers, Theodore and Ernest James.The partnership split up and Theodore James was left with the firm.In 1978 the company moved from Bedlington Station to West Sleekburn and this has proved to be a much better location.The present site was owned by Northern Concrete( part of Tar-Mac Limited). The site consists of 7.46 acres of land and when they first came to the location there was a lot of grass land which has now been built over.The main disadvantage is that it is not very easy to drive vehicles in and out.The vehicles include 25 heavy goods wagons,20 trailers,3 forklifts,1 pallet truck and three heavy trucks.
